% Abbreviations.
\newcommand{\slr}{$SLR$\xspace}
\newcommand{\lalr}{$LALR$\xspace}
\newcommand{\lr}{$LR$\xspace}
\newcommand{\lrzero}{$LR(0)$\xspace}
\newcommand{\lrone}{$LR(1)$\xspace}

% Language generated by.
\newcommand{\lang}[1]{\mathcal{L}(#1)}

% Notations.
\newcommand{\term}{a}
\newcommand{\nonterm}{A}
\newcommand{\sym}{X}
\newcommand{\sv}{v} % semantic value
\newcommand{\phrase}{\alpha} % sequence of symbols
\newcommand{\word}{w} % finite sequences of tokens (terminal + value)
\newcommand{\stream}{\omega} % infinite sequences of tokens
\newcommand{\sst}[1]{\llbracket#1\rrbracket} % symbol_semantic_type
\newcommand{\produ}[2]{#1\longrightarrow#2}
\newcommand{\production}[3]{\produ{#1}{#2}\;\{#3\}} % structure des productions
\newcommand{\stack}{s}
\newcommand{\state}{\sigma}
\newcommand{\State}{\Sigma}
\newcommand{\Init}{\textit{init}} % Ã©tat initial
\newcommand{\sa}{f} % semantic action function
\newcommand{\hsv}[3]{#1\stackrel{#3}{\longrightarrow}#2} % has_semantic_value \sym \word \sv
\newcommand{\EOS}{\texttt{\#}}
\newcommand{\grammar}{\mathcal{G}}
\newcommand{\automaton}{\mathcal{A}}
% Actions.
\newcommand{\Aaccept}{\textit{accept}}
\newcommand{\Ashift}[1]{\textit{shift}\;#1}
\newcommand{\Areduce}[1]{\textit{reduce}\;#1}
\newcommand{\Areject}{\textit{reject}}
% Annotations
\newcommand{\lss}[1]{\textit{incoming}(#1)} % last_symbol_of_noninit_state
\newcommand{\pss}[1]{\textit{pastSymbols}(#1)} % past_symbol_of_noninit_state
\newcommand{\psts}[1]{\textit{pastStates}(#1)} % past_state_of_noninit_state
% Parse results.
\newcommand{\Rreject}{\textit{reject}}
\newcommand{\Rtimeout}{\textit{out-of-fuel}}
\newcommand{\Rparsed}[2]{\textit{parsed}\;#1\;#2}
% Parse stack.
\newcommand{\Nil}{\epsilon} % the empty stack is an empty list
\newcommand{\Cons}[3]{#1(#2,#3)}
%
\newcommand{\parse}[2]{\textit{parse}(#1, #2)}
% Error monad.
\newcommand{\Err}{\lightning}
% LR items.
\newcommand{\lritem}[4]{\produ{#1}{#2{}\bullet{}#3}\;[#4]}
\newcommand{\items}[1]{\textit{items}(#1)}
% The sequence of symbols that underlies a stack.
\newcommand{\symsOfStack}[1]{\textit{symbols}(#1)}
% The sequence of states that underlies a stack.
\newcommand{\statesOfStack}[1]{\textit{states}(#1)}
% The stack invariant (for safety).
\newcommand{\stackinv}[1]{\textit{safe}\;#1}
% FIRST, NULLABLE.
\newcommand{\first}[1]{\textit{first}(#1)}
\newcommand{\nullable}[1]{\textit{nullable}(#1)}
